text: Myer Samuel Kripke (January 21, 1914 - April 11, 2014) was an American rabbi, scholar, and philanthropist. He was the leader of Beth El Synagogue. He was also known for investing into Warren Buffett. Kripke was born in Toledo, Ohio. He and his wife, Dorothy, had three children. Their son, Saul, is a philosopher and logician. Kripke died from natural causes on April 11, 2014 in Omaha, Nebraska, aged 100. ==References== ==Other websites== * Myer S.
